text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The candidate answer discusses Tag-Along rights under section 6, but it defines them as: \"Inverse of drag-along: if founders sell their stake, you can join in at the same price/terms.\" This definition is correct for Tag-Along rights. However, the rubric criterion specifically asks for the definition of the Tag-Along right as ensuring the investor can sell a *pro rata portion* of shares alongside the founders on the same terms. While the candidate's definition is generally correct, it omits the explicit mention of selling a 'pro rata portion,' which is the specific detail required by the criterion.", "criterion_id": "32a99ce4-2e4a-42d1-bf72-6db07c939b16"}
